intro: Psychotria curviflora, commonly known as the "devil's breath" or "coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been historically used in traditional medicine and spiritual practices.
